creator: robert.leathley@ricardo.com
text:
It would be useful to be able to abort WebdavResource methods (such as put, get,
copy, move), eg. if a large file were taking too long to transfer

HttpClient v3.0 provides an abort() method.  Could Slide be modified to expose this?

creator: robert.leathley@ricardo.com
text:
It would be even better if it could monitor Thread.isInterrupted() and abort in
a similar way to java.nio.channels.InterruptibleChannel

The client library currently uses HttpClient 2.0, so the short answer is no. If
the dependency is changed, I believe you can get the HttpClient instance used by
the WebdavResource then call the method directly.
creator: masonjm@apache.org

text:
The method is HttpMethod.abort() so you need to be able to get hold of the
appropriate HttpMethod generated by WebdavResource rather than the instance of
the HttpClient, unless I am missing something.

New methods: 'Object WebdavResource.getMethodRef()' etc. could be created to
return an HttpMethod object reference (or a key for a map maintained by
WebdavResource, which may be necessary if WebdavResource methods call several
HttpClient methods).  You would then need something like: 'boolean
WebdavResource.executeMethod(key)' and 'void WebdavResource.abortMethod(key)'

Or could WebdavResource could monitor the Thread interrupt flag somehow?

Is Slide going to migrate to HttpClient 3.0 soon?  If so, I could implement one
of the above myself and let you decide on whether to merge it back.
creator: robert.leathley@ricardo.com

text:
This is the first request that *I've* heard of to move the HttpClient 3, but
it's possible I've missed something.

Could you put together a patch that adds this feature?
creator: masonjm@apache.org

text:
I should be able to create the patch once I have a version of the Slide client
lib that uses HttpClient 3, but I don't think I can do the upgrade from 2 to 3.

I assume that Slide will eventually move to 3 as 2 has limited support now, but
this may be some time off yet?
creator: robert.leathley@ricardo.com

text:
I haven't heard of any push to move to 3, so I can't say how long it will be. It
will probably happen as soon as someone steps up with the desire to put in the
effort :).

I'm going to mark this as "later" and we can revisit it after the migration to
HttpClient 3 is started.
creator: masonjm@apache.org
